txt.en: 'You are [placeholder], the [placeholder]? You must be. Who else might carry themselves as you do?\n\n'I have been looking for you. The Steward has summoned you.'

The Council of Gondor meets in the Dome of the Sun on the Sixth Circle of Minas Tirith. Mithrandir can be found at the Court of the Fountain, in the Citadel atop the city. Echadon can be found at the south end of the Second Circle.\n\nImrahil has asked you to provide help to a number of people within the city before the city is encircled by a ring of foes.
Ormatar is in the Citadel, the highest level of Minas Tirith.\n\nYou learned that Ormatar has been seeking you, and you should find out what he wants.
Talk to Arodor and complete 'A Long Siege'
Talk to Mithrandir and complete 'A Matter of Lineage'
Talk to Echadon and complete 'Reserves of Courage'
Prince Imrahil is in the First Circle of Minas Tirith, by the main gate of the city, preparing for battle.
Talk to Imrahil in the First Circle of Minas Tirith, by the main gate to the city

'While you were surveying the situation in Talath Anor, I learned of a handful of folk who desire your assistance with matters both large and small. Go to them and see what they need, if you can.

'Mithrandir wished to speak with you at greater length about your encounter with the enemy commander in Osgiliath. Find him in the Citadel, atop the city.

'Arodor, the chief scribe of the Council, was impressed with your work on his behalf and asked for you to speak with him in the Dome of the Sun, in the Sixth Circle. The Council was waiting for Ingold to return to the city; perhaps your experience beyond the Rammas Echor will be of interest to them.

'In other Council matters, the Captain of the Garrison has been trying to improve the morale of folk remaining in the city. Find Echadon and see what you can do to help.'
Talk to Ormatar in the Citadel atop Minas Tirith

'I received word that Ormatar, the Captain of the Citadel, has been looking for you. You should speak to him in the Citadel, without delay, for that can mean only one thing. Go to Ormatar with haste.'
The enemies of Gondor approach Minas Tirith from the north and from the east, and many folk in the city desire your help before the city is completely surrounded.

'Minas Tirith will soon be encircled by our enemies, [placeholder]. Time is getting short, but we must fill the hours or minutes that remain to us with preparations that will help us survive the approaching onslaught!

'While you were surveying the situation in Talath Anor, I learned of a handful of folk who desire your assistance with matters both large and small. Go to them and see what they need, if you can.

'Mithrandir wished to speak with you at greater length about your encounter with the enemy commander in Osgiliath. Find him in the Citadel, atop the city.

'Arodor, the chief scribe of the Council, was impressed with your work on his behalf and asked for you to speak with him in the Dome of the Sun, in the Sixth Circle. The Council was waiting for Ingold to return to the city; perhaps your experience beyond the Rammas Echor will be of interest to them.

'In other Council matters, the Captain of the Garrison has been trying to improve the morale of folk remaining in the city. Find Echadon and see what you can do to help.'

'It will not be long before the city is surrounded. I hope we are ready.'

Imrahil stares at you appraisingly.

'I have a message for you, [placeholder]. I received word that Ormatar, the Captain of the Citadel, has been looking for you. You should speak to him in the Citadel, without delay, for that can mean only one thing. Go to Ormatar with haste.'
